newsitem.title: USA: Manufactured Homes renews Chateau bid.
newsitem.headline: Manufactured Homes renews Chateau bid.

text.p: Manufactured Home Communities Inc said on Wednesday that it has started a cash tender for the 6.1 million outstanding shares of Chateau Properties Inc at $26 per share.
The bid comes after an earlier, similar offer by Manufactured Communities chairman Samuel Zell to which Chateau did not respond, it said.
It said that it remained willing to enter into negotiations with Chateau at any time.
Manufactured Home's bid for Chateau competes with Sun Communities Inc's $372 million unsolicited stock offer for the firm.
Michigan-based Chateau has previously agreed to merge with ROC Communities Inc in a tax-free stock swap.
Manufactured Home's proposal, first made August 16, offers Chateau shareholders $26 a share in cash or 1.15 Manufactured Home shares for each Chateau share, or a combination of both.
Manufactured Home said it believes its offer provides a "substantially greater" value to Chateau's shareholders than the proposed ROC transaction or Sun Communities' bid.

"The combination of Chateau and (Manufactured Home) will unite the two highest quality portfolios in the industry," David Helfand, chief executive officer of Manufactured Home, said in a statement. "The new entity would have superior financial strength, significant liquidity and unparalleled access to capital."
Zell added in a statement that Manufactured Home was "determined to take every appropriate action to successfully consummate this transaction."

Manufactured Home said its tender offer is not subject to any financing contingencies. The offer is subject to certain conditions, including the tender of at least two-thirds of the outstanding shares.
The tender offer is scheduled to expire October 1.
